maze.logic

Class Dragon

  • java.lang.Object
    • maze.logic.Element
      • maze.logic.Moveable
        • maze.logic.Dragon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Dragon
extends Moveable
    Class that represents all "dragon" type objects. A dragon is either awake or asleep. Any other behaviours and/or parameters are inherited from Moveable.
    See Also:
    Moveable, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isAwake

        public boolean isAwake()
        Gets the value of the parameter [awake].
        Returns:
        true if the dragon is awake

      • setAwake

        public void setAwake(boolean awake)
        Sets the value of the parameter [awake].
        Parameters:
        awake - : value to be set

      • getRoundsToWake

        public int getRoundsToWake()
        Gets the value of the parameter [roundstoWake].
        Returns:
        the number of rounds before the dragon awakes

      • setRoundsToWake

        public void setRoundsToWake(int roundsToWake)
        Sets the value of the parameter [roundstoWake].
        Parameters:
        roundsToWake - : the number of rounds to pass before the dragon awakes

      • setDragonState

        public void setDragonState()
        Checks and sets if a dragon is asleep or not. If the dragon is asleep, decrements its parameter [roundsToWake] and verifies if the dragon has awoken (roundsToWake <= 0). If the dragon is awake, the function randomly decides whether the dragon goes to sleep.

      • update

        public void update(GameLogic game)
        Updates a dragon: - calls setDragonState(); - randomly moves the dragon; - checks for found swords by the dragon.
        Parameters:
        game - : current GameLogic instance
